triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the foundation models that the paper improves through reinforcement learning for reasoning tasks.

triples.name: Chain of thought
triples.relevance: CoT prompting is a foundational technique the paper builds upon to improve reasoning in language models.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using RL as the core framework to train models for reasoning without human-annotated trajectories.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: Supervised learning on human demonstrations is the conventional approach that the paper contrasts with its RL framework.

triples.name: Reasoning model
triples.relevance: The paper develops improved reasoning models through RL that demonstrate emergent reasoning patterns.

triples.name: Self-reflection
triples.relevance: Self-reflection emerges as an advanced reasoning pattern developed by the RL-trained models.

triples.name: Mathematical problem
triples.relevance: Mathematics is one of the key verifiable tasks where the paper demonstrates superior performance.

triples.name: Competitive programming
triples.relevance: Coding competitions represent a verifiable task domain where the RL-trained models achieve improved results.

triples.name: STEM fields
triples.relevance: STEM fields are the broader domain of application where the paper demonstrates performance improvements.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Verification capabilities emerge as an advanced reasoning pattern developed by the RL-trained models.
